'''Hobson''' was the son of [[Hob Gammidge]]. He was the first to adopt the family's birth place as a family name, with his byname '''Roper Gamgee'''.

==History==
Hobson was the son of Hob Gammidge, and had four children: [[Andwise Roper|Andy]], [[Gaffer Gamgee|Ham]], [[May (hobbit)|May]] and [[Halfred of Overhill|Halfred]].<ref>{{App|Gamgee}}</ref>

Hobson owned a ropewalk in [[Tighfield]]. After his death, Andy took over business, and took the surname "Roper".<ref>{{TT|Taming}}</ref>

==Etymology==
Hobson was fittingly named the "Son of [[Hob Gammidge|Hob]]. His byname "Roper Gamgee" he earned from his profession and the birthplace of his ancestors, Gamwich. His two eldest sons would each use part of the byname as a surname: [[Andwise Roper]] and [[Gaffer Gamgee|Hamfast Gamgee]].
